meanings.definition: The process of introducing market principles or mechanisms into a system or sector.
meanings.sent1: The marketization of healthcare led to increased competition among hospitals.
meanings.sent2: In the marketization of education, schools started to operate more like businesses.
meanings.sent3: The marketization of the school cafeteria made lunchtime feel like a stock exchange.
meanings.sent4: Her idea for the marketization of art turned the gallery into a bustling marketplace.
meanings.sent5: The marketization of the music industry transformed it into a cutthroat business arena.

meanings.definition: The act of making something subject to market forces or competition.
meanings.sent1: Marketization of the telecommunications industry brought in new players.
meanings.sent2: The marketization of farming resulted in better quality produce.
meanings.sent3: The marketization of lemonade stands turned the neighborhood into a mini marketplace.
meanings.sent4: Her marketization of the lemonade recipe made it a sought-after commodity.
meanings.sent5: The marketization of the toy industry made it a fierce battleground for companies.
